page.title: 01PRESTON.HEART OF LANCASHIRE.
page.content: Preston is an abbreviation of priest town,which rightly indicates its strong religious traditions.Roman Catholicism is still strong in the area & has been joined by Muslim & West Indian culture. Originally a town of trade & craftsmen,it became centre of the textile industry,specialising in cotton sheets & towelling.This lasted for over 100 years but eventually, a victim of cheap foreign imports,the textile industry declined to be replaced by aircraft construction and major electrical plant manufacture. A major crossroads for all parts of Lancashire. Preston has seen an influx of immigrants from both the Indian Sub-continent and the West Indies. It is now the heart of the Central Lancashire New Town based on Leyland,Chorley and itself.
